title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1290.8 - Smoking, operation of cutting torches and like devices restricted
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1290.8 - Smoking, operation of cutting torches and like devices restricted

State Regulations

No person shall smoke or carry lighted cigars, cigarettes, pipes, matches or any naked flame in any place where smoking is specifically
prohibited by signs, and no person shall operate at the World Trade Center an
oxyacetylene torch, electric arc or similar flame or spark producing device. No
person shall tamper with any fire prevention, warning or extinguisher equipment
at the World Trade Center nor use the same for any purpose other than fire
fighting or fire prevention. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1290.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
